org.trianacode.gui.panels

Class ParameterPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.trianacode.gui.panels.ParameterPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, WindowButtonConstants, TaskListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AddParameterNodePanel, ArrayViewerPanel, BasicIWIRPanel, ClassPathPanel, CompilePanel, CondorPanel, CondorSubmitDescriptionPanel, ConstViewPanel, DBExplorePanel, EventViewerPanel, FilePanel, GnuplotGrapherPanel, GroupEditor, GroupParameterPanel, GUICreaterPanel, HetdyneFpanel, HistogrammerPanel, HTMLViewPanel, ImagePanel, ImportGSMPanel, InOutPanel, IsPanel, IwirCreatorPanel, JPlotterPanel, LoadMoviePanel, LoadMP3Panel, LoadSoundPanel, LoopPanel, NodeConfigPanel, NodeEditor, OptionsPanel, PanelHolder, ParameterPanelImp, ParamNameChangePanel, ParamViewPanel, PastePanel, SaveHistoryPanel, SequenceBufferPanel, SerializePanel, SettingObjectOutputPanel, SGTGrapherPanel, SGTTimeFreqPanel, StringEditorPanel, StringGenPanel, StringViewPanel, TextAreaPanel, ToolBoxPanel, TriggerButtonPanel, UnitPanel, UnknownToolBoxTypePanel

    public abstract class ParameterPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements WindowButtonConstants, TaskListener
    A base panel that provides methods for updating task parameters.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParameterPanel

        public ParameterPanel()
        Creates a Triana parameter panel associated with the specified task.

    • Method Detail

      • setTask

        public void setTask(Task task)

      • getTask

        public Task getTask()
        Returns:
        the Task associated with this ParameterPanel

      • setParameter

        public void setParameter(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.Object value)
        Sets a paremeter in the associated task to the specified value.

        If the panel is attached to a group then parameter names of the form taskname.paramname or groupname.taskname.paramname will set the parameter within the specified sub task. If the panel isn't attached to a group then the groupname.taskname section is ignored.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the parameter to be set
        value - the value the parameter is set to

      • removeParameter

        public void removeParameter(java.lang.String name)
        Removes a paremeter in the associated task.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the parameter to be removed

      • getParameter

        public java.lang.Object getParameter(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the value of a parameter in the associated task
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the parameter to return
        Returns:
        the parameter value

      • isParameterName

        public boolean isParameterName(java.lang.String name)
        Returns true if a value is set for a parameter in the associated task
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the parameter
        Returns:
        true if a value is set for the parameter

      • getPreferredButtons

        public byte getPreferredButtons()
        This method returns WindowButtonConstants.OK_CANCEL_APPLY_BUTTONS by default. It should be overridden if the panel has different preferred set of buttons.
        Returns:
        the panels preferred button combination (as defined in Windows Constants).

      • isAlwaysOnTopPreferred

        public boolean isAlwaysOnTopPreferred()
        This method returns true by default. It should be overridden if the panel prefers to be allowed to be hidden behind the main triana window.
        Returns:
        true by default

      • isAutoCommitVisible

        public boolean isAutoCommitVisible()
        This method returns true by default. It should be overridden if the panel does not want the user to be able to change the auto commit state

      • isAutoCommitByDefault

        public boolean isAutoCommitByDefault()
        This method returns false by default. It should be overridden if the panel wants parameter changes to be commited automatically

      • setWindowInterface

        public void setWindowInterface(ParameterWindowInterface comp)
        Sets the component that determines whether parameter changes are committed automatically

      • getWindowInterface

        public ParameterWindowInterface getWindowInterface()
        Returns:
        the component that determines whether parameter changes are committed automatically

      • isAutoCommit

        public boolean isAutoCommit()
        Returns:
        true if parameters are automatically committed

      • init

        public abstract void init()
        This method is called when the task is set for this panel. It is overridden to create the panel layout.

      • reset

        public abstract void reset()
        This method is called when the panel is reset or cancelled. It should reset all the panels components to the values specified by the associated task, e.g. a component representing a parameter called "noise" should be set to the value returned by a getTool().getParameter("noise") call.

      • dispose

        public abstract void dispose()
        This method is called when the panel is finished with. It should dispose of any components (e.g. windows) used by the panel.

      • disposePanel

        public void disposePanel()
        Disposes of the parameter panel, calls dispose on the subclassing panel

      • parameterUpdate

        public void parameterUpdate(java.lang.String paramname,
                   java.lang.Object value)
        This method is called when a parameter in the associated task is updated. It should be overridden to update the GUI in response to the parameter update

      • okClicked

        public void okClicked()
        Called when the ok button is clicked on the parameter window. Calls applyClicked by default to commit any parameter changes.

      • cancelClicked

        public void cancelClicked()
        Called when the cancel button is clicked on the parameter window. Parameter changes are not commited.

      • applyClicked

        public void applyClicked()
        Called when the apply button is clicked on the parameter window. Commits any parameter changes.

      • getWindow

        protected java.awt.Window getWindow()
        Convinence method that returns the window the panel is in.

      • getMenuBar

        public javax.swing.JMenuBar getMenuBar()
        Returns:
        the menu bar for this panel (null if none)

      • setMenuBar

        public void setMenuBar(javax.swing.JMenuBar menubar)
        Sets the menu bar for this component

      • taskPropertyUpdate

        public void taskPropertyUpdate(TaskPropertyEvent event)
        Called when the core properties of a task change i.e. its name, whether it is running continuously etc.
        Specified by:
        taskPropertyUpdate in interface TaskListener

      • parameterUpdated

        public void parameterUpdated(ParameterUpdateEvent event)
        Called when the value of a parameter is changed, including when a parameter is removed.
        Specified by:
        parameterUpdated in interface TaskListener

      • nodeRemoved

        public void nodeRemoved(TaskNodeEvent event)
        Called before a data input node is removed.
        Specified by:
        nodeRemoved in interface TaskListener

      • nodeAdded

        public void nodeAdded(TaskNodeEvent event)
        Called when a data input node is added.
        Specified by:
        nodeAdded in interface TaskListener

      • taskDisposed

        public void taskDisposed(TaskDisposedEvent event)
        Called before the task is disposed
        Specified by:
        taskDisposed in interface TaskListener
